channel.title: Github-Copilot on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Github-Copilot on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Claude and Codex now available for Copilot Business & Pro users
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Business and Copilot Pro customers can now use Anthropic Claude and OpenAI Codex as coding agents. Copilot Enterprise and Pro+ customers got access earlier in February 2026.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Building Long-Distance Next Edit Suggestions
item.description:
VS Code describes extending GitHub Copilot Next Edit Suggestions so they can propose edits across an entire file rather than only nearby locations.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Gemini 3.1 Pro is now in public preview in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out public preview access to Google’s Gemini 3.1 Pro model.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Use Copilot coding agent with Windows projects
item.description:
Copilot coding agent can now be used with Windows projects, running tasks asynchronously in a GitHub Actions-powered development environment.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent supports code referencing
item.description:
Copilot coding agent now supports Copilot code referencing for generated code that matches code in public GitHub repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.6 is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Claude Opus 4.6 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot for Enterprise, Business, Pro, and Pro+ plans. It can be used in Copilot Chat on github.com and in supported IDEs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Sonnet 4.6 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out support for Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.6, now generally available. GitHub notes early testing shows strong performance on agentic coding, especially search.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: MCP Registry and more improvements in Copilot in Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub shipped updates to Copilot in Eclipse aimed at improving context handling, workflow smoothness, and customization.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Delegate tasks to Copilot coding agent from Visual Studio
item.description:
Visual Studio can now delegate coding tasks to GitHub Copilot coding agent, which runs asynchronously in the cloud and produces a draft pull request.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New features and improvements in GitHub Copilot in JetBrains IDEs
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for JetBrains IDEs received an update adding preview support for Agent Skills plus UX improvements in inline chat and settings.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET Brings AI-powered Unit Tests to Visual Studio 2026
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET is generally available in Visual Studio 18.3, adding an AI-assisted workflow to generate and iterate on unit tests directly in the IDE.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: GPT-5.3-Codex is now generally available for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out general availability of OpenAI’s GPT-5.3-Codex model.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Fast mode for Claude Opus 4.6 is now in preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out a research/public preview of Claude Opus 4.6 “Fast mode.” The mode increases output token generation speed by up to 2.5×.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.6 is now generally available for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out support for Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.6 model and marking it as generally available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code v1.109 – January Release
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for VS Code v1.109 (January 2026) adds agent-driven workflows, improves agent session management, and introduces agent support for Anthropic Claude models.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — January update
item.description:
January 2026 updates to GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio add colorized code completions, the ability to partially accept a completion, and general productivity improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics in GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot metrics — including usage data, code generation dashboards, and a metrics API — are available in public preview for GitHub Enterprise Cloud customers with data residency, enabling organizations to store and query Copilot metrics according to regional compliance requirements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.2-Codex is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.2-Codex is generally available for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+, and is now accessible in GitHub Copilot Chat on the web and mobile as well as integrated into Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Plan before you build, steer as you go
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that introduce more powerful reasoning models and intelligent workflow features, enabling developers to plan work before generating code and to steer interactive terminal conversations as they go.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Install and Use GitHub Copilot CLI directly from the GitHub CLI
item.description:
GitHub CLI now provides a built-in gh copilot command that lets users install and run the GitHub Copilot CLI directly from the GitHub CLI. The previous GitHub Copilot extension for gh has been deprecated in favor of this integrated approach.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot bring your own key (BYOK) enhancements
item.description:
GitHub announced enhancements to Copilot’s Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) capability: it now supports additional APIs, includes new configuration options, and adds more provider integrations so enterprises can connect models (including those that use the Responses API).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Building docfind: Fast Client-Side Search with Rust and WebAssembly
item.description:
The article describes building docfind, a high-performance client-side search engine implemented in Rust and compiled to WebAssembly, and highlights how GitHub Copilot sped up development.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Copilot SDK in technical preview
item.description:
GitHub released the Copilot SDK in technical preview, offering language-specific SDKs that let developers programmatically access the GitHub Copilot CLI.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.2-Codex is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.2-Codex is now generally available in GitHub Copilot and can be selected from the Copilot model picker for eligible plans.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Upcoming deprecation of select GitHub Copilot models from Claude, Google, and OpenAI
item.description:
GitHub announced on Jan 13, 2026 that it will deprecate select GitHub Copilot models from Claude, Google, and OpenAI as part of routine retirements to prioritize newer, more capable models and maintain a fast, high‑quality Copilot experience.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Flash is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub released Gemini 3 Flash in public preview for GitHub Copilot Chat inside Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse, available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.5 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Claude Opus 4.5 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot and can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers. The announcement was published on The GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise-level pull request activity now included in Copilot Usage Metrics in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has added enterprise-level pull request activity metrics to Copilot Usage Metrics (now in public preview), letting organizations see PR creation and review activity across the enterprise and how GitHub Copilot participates in that workflow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.2 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.2 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot (Dec 17, 2025). The model is available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers and can be used in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com and GitHub Mobile.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub has made the GPT-5.1-Codex-Max model generally available in GitHub Copilot for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+. The model can be used in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com and GitHub Mobile.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.1 and GPT-5.1-Codex are now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.1 and GPT-5.1-Codex are now generally available for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+, and can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Flash is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that Gemini 3 Flash, a speed-focused variant of Gemini 3 suited for tasks where low latency matters, is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: C++ code editing tools for GitHub Copilot in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that C++ code editing tools for GitHub Copilot are now in public preview, delivered with the latest Visual Studio 2026 Insiders release. The tools extend Copilot’s ability to understand and modify C++ code inside the IDE.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Pro is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Gemini 3 Pro is available in public preview for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ users and can be accessed via GitHub Copilot Chat and directly in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI’s GPT-5.2 is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
OpenAI’s GPT-5.2 is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot, a model optimized for long context handling and front-end UI generation, and is available to Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise users (announced on the GitHub Blog, 2025-12-11).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — November update
item.description:
The November 2025 update for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio announced the general availability of Visual Studio 2026, added new Copilot actions integrated into the IDE, and rolled out additional improvements; full details are in the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.5 is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub announced that Claude Opus 4.5 is available in public preview for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+. The model can be accessed via GitHub Copilot Chat and is integrated into major IDEs including Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.5 is in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.5 is now rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot; early tests show it outperforms internal coding benchmarks while cutting token usage roughly in half.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Supercharge Your Test Coverage with GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET is now available in Visual Studio, allowing developers to automatically generate, build, and run high-quality unit tests across files, projects, or entire solutions to boost test coverage and speed up the testing workflow.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: A step-by-step guide to modernizing .NET applications with GitHub Copilot agent mode
item.description:
This .NET Blog post shows a step-by-step workflow using Visual Studio 2026 and GitHub Copilot agent mode to modernize .NET applications by upgrading .NET versions and frameworks, resolving build issues, and migrating apps to Azure with reduced manual effort.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Enhanced MCP OAuth support for GitHub Copilot in JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode
item.description:
GitHub Copilot plugins for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now include enhanced authentication capabilities that expand support for third‑party OAuth providers using a secure, flexible approach based on Dynamic Client Registration (DCR).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom agents available in GitHub Copilot for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now offers custom agents in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode. These agents let teams package reusable expertise, enforce guardrails, and grant tool access so AI behavior can be tailored to specific projects and workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot coding agent for Eclipse now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent is now available in public preview for Eclipse, bringing Copilot directly into native Eclipse workflows and adding features such as the ability to delegate tasks from within the IDE.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Plan mode in GitHub Copilot now in public preview in JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s Plan mode is now available in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode, announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Generally Available: MSSQL extension integration with GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of an integration between the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code and GitHub Copilot, bringing AI-powered SQL assistance into the VS Code workflow to reduce repetitive tasks, accelerate development, and assist with database schema design.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: PostgreSQL extension for Visual Studio Code with GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Microsoft announces the general availability of the PostgreSQL extension for Visual Studio Code, which enables connecting to PostgreSQL instances, running queries, managing connection profiles, and supports Microsoft Entra ID with integration for GitHub Copilot.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Pro is in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Google’s Gemini 3 Pro model is now available in public preview within GitHub Copilot for Pro, Pro+ Business, and Enterprise subscribers; the rollout is gradual and announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: GitHub Copilot app modernization expanded capabilities
item.description:
Microsoft announced public preview enhancements to GitHub Copilot App Modernization that expand capabilities to help modernize applications, databases, and containers and accelerate migrations to Azure.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: GitHub Copilot app modernization expanded capabilities
item.description:
Azure announced Generally Available enhancements to GitHub Copilot App Modernization, expanding capabilities to simplify modernization of applications, databases and containers and to accelerate migrations to Azure.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Visual Studio 2026
item.description:
Microsoft announced Visual Studio 2026 is generally available. The release modernizes the IDE with deep AI integration, including built-in GitHub Copilot and support for agentic workflows, to help professional developers work more productively.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: OpenAI’s GPT-5.1, GPT-5.1-Codex and GPT-5.1-Codex-Mini are now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot has begun a public preview rollout of OpenAI’s latest 5.1-series models—GPT-5.1, GPT-5.1-Codex, and GPT-5.1-Codex-Mini—bringing the new general and code-specialized models (including a smaller, low‑cost/low‑latency Codex-Mini) to Copilot users. The announcement was posted on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Manage Copilot coding agent tasks in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
GitHub announced that you can now track and manage the Copilot coding agent directly within Visual Studio Code using a streamlined, centralized “mission control” view that includes access to session logs and management tools without leaving the editor.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection for Copilot in Visual Studio in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio now offers an ‘Auto’ option in the model picker (public preview) that selects the best Copilot model for you automatically.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Sonnet 3.5 deprecated, Claude Haiku 4.5 available in Copilot Free
item.description:
GitHub deprecated Claude Sonnet 3.5 across all Copilot experiences on November 10, 2025, and made Claude Haiku 4.5 available in Copilot Free.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Raptor mini is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub has begun a public preview rollout of Raptor mini, an experimental model available in GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio Code. The model is being made available to users on Pro, Pro+, and Free plans and can be selected within the Copilot settings. The announcement appeared on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: GitHub Copilot in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) is available in public preview. It provides context-aware assistance to help you write Transact-SQL (T-SQL) faster and more accurately and can answer general SQL questions using database and connection context.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Introducing Custom Agents for .NET Developers: C# Expert & WinForms Expert
item.description:
Microsoft announced two experimental custom agents for .NET developers — C# Expert and WinForms Expert — designed to help produce better code when used with GitHub Copilot. The agents are tailored to C# and WinForms development and were introduced on the .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code gets upgraded
item.description:
GitHub announced upgrades to Copilot in Visual Studio Code (released to VS Code Insiders) at GitHub Universe 2025, including integration with OpenAI Codex for Copilot Pro+ users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Selected Claude, OpenAI, and Gemini Copilot models are now deprecated
item.description:
On October 23, 2025, GitHub deprecated selected Claude, OpenAI, and Gemini models across all GitHub Copilot experiences (including Copilot Chat, inline edits, ask and agent modes, and code completions), according to a GitHub Blog changelog post.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot CLI: Multiline input, new MCP enhancements, and Haiku 4.5
item.description:
GitHub announced daily improvements to Copilot CLI, highlighting multiline input support, a set of new MCP enhancements, and the Haiku 4.5 update. The changelog credits developer feedback—bug reports, feature requests, and discussions—for driving these ongoing improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-4.1 Copilot code completion model — October update
item.description:
GitHub updated the GPT-4.1 Copilot code completion model (October update) to better infer developer intent from surrounding code, resulting in more accurate code completion suggestions in GitHub Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Grok Code Fast 1 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Grok Code Fast 1 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot and can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat. The release is available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot-generated commit messages on github.com are generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now provides contextual commit message suggestions for file changes on github.com. The feature, previously in public preview, is now generally available to help make writing commit documentation easier and faster.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Anthropic’s Claude Haiku 4.5 is in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Anthropic’s Claude Haiku 4.5 — a newer, higher-performance and faster model — is rolling out in GitHub Copilot and is now available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4.5 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4.5 is now generally available inside GitHub Copilot. The model can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat and is available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Upcoming deprecation of Claude Sonnet 3.5
item.description:
GitHub will deprecate Claude Sonnet 3.5 across all Copilot experiences (including Copilot Chat, inline edits, ask and agent modes, and code completions) on November 6, 2025. The change signals a move to newer, more capable models. The announcement appeared on The GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Grok Code Fast 1 is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Grok Code Fast 1 is now available in public preview through GitHub Copilot Chat and is integrated into major IDEs including Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse. The preview is accessible to GitHub Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise plan subscribers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Sonnet 4.5 is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Claude Sonnet 4.5 is available in public preview through GitHub Copilot Chat for users on Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise plans, and can be used in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection is now in VS Code for Copilot Business and Enterprise
item.description:
GitHub announced that auto model selection in Visual Studio Code is now available in public preview for Copilot Business and Enterprise plans; the feature automatically selects the appropriate model for you.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — September update
item.description:
The September 2025 GitHub Copilot update for Visual Studio adds new Profiler and .NET Modernization agents, enhances MCP interactions, and introduces smarter code review capabilities to speed debugging, modernization, and developer workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.5 is in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4.5, described as their most advanced model for coding and real‑world agents, is rolling out in public preview inside GitHub Copilot and is available to Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.1 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that Claude Opus 4.1 is now generally available within GitHub Copilot. The model is accessible to Copilot Pro+ and Copilot Enterprise subscribers via GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com and in clients such as VS Code (and other supported editors).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI GPT-5-Codex is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
OpenAI’s GPT-5-Codex, a model optimized for agentic coding, is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot. The model will be available to Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: GitHub Copilot app modernization capabilities for Java and .NET are now available
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of GitHub Copilot app modernization capabilities for Java and .NET. The offering is designed to reduce redundant, complex work involved in modernizing applications so developers can focus on innovation, while helping ensure apps remain secure, scalable, and up to date.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Copilot-SWE model rolling out to Visual Studio Code Insiders
item.description:
GitHub is rolling out Copilot-SWE, an experimental Copilot model optimized for code-related tasks, to Visual Studio Code Insiders as a technical preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Prompt Files and Instructions Files Explained
item.description:
A .NET Blog post explaining how GitHub Copilot’s prompt files and instruction files help .NET developers guide and standardize AI-assisted code generation to improve productivity and consistency.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Anthropic Claude Opus 4.1 is now available in public preview in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.1 has entered public preview for GitHub Copilot users and is being rolled out in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse, as announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps
item.description:
Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps helps .NET developers detect performance bottlenecks and receive AI-driven code improvement suggestions via GitHub Copilot integration, streamlining diagnostics and optimizations within the .NET ecosystem.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in VS Code August release (v1.104)
item.description:
The August 2025 update (v1.104) for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code delivers improvements aimed at greater flexibility, security, and productivity in AI-powered development workflows, and includes auto model selection in Copilot Chat.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New features in GitHub Copilot in Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub shipped improvements to GitHub Copilot in Eclipse that add more context options, smoother workflows, and better customization to make the extension smarter and easier to use.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Let Copilot Coding Agent handle the busy work
item.description:
The .NET Blog post demonstrates how the GitHub Copilot Coding Agent automates repetitive developer tasks—like generating unit tests and implementing features from a PRD—using a real .NET sample, enabling developers to concentrate on design and code review.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Copilot’s next edit suggestion (NES) in public preview in JetBrains
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s Next Edit Suggestions (NES) feature is now in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, enabling proactive code editing and improvement suggestions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent now supports AGENTS.md custom instructions
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent now supports AGENTS.md custom instructions, allowing users to guide the agent on project understanding and how to build, test, and validate changes.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Start and track Copilot coding agent tasks from Raycast
item.description:
Raycast, a macOS launcher, now supports interaction with AI agents, including starting and tracking GitHub Copilot coding agent tasks.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI GPT-5 mini is now available in public preview in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
OpenAI’s GPT-5 mini is now publicly available in preview for GitHub Copilot users within Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — August update
item.description:
The August 2025 update for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio 2022 (v17.14) introduces a smarter Copilot powered by GPT-5, general availability of the Microsoft Copilot Platform (MCP), and enhanced user control features.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code completion now uses the GPT-4.1 Copilot model
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s code completion feature has been upgraded to use the GPT-4.1 Copilot model, which enhances coding capabilities and includes updated training data beyond the previous knowledge cutoff.

  • Source: GitHub
